summary: This document is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (USANYS) prosecutors discussing revisions to a draft indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell. The emails coordinate scheduling a call to discuss legal questions, specifically regarding 'over acts', and share updated drafts of the indictment.

events.title: Draft Maxwell Indictment Circulated
events.description: A draft of the Ghislaine Maxwell indictment is circulated among prosecutors for review.

events.title: Call Scheduled to Discuss Indictment
events.description: Prosecutors schedule a call to discuss the draft indictment, specifically the 'over acts' question.

events.title: Revised Draft Indictment Sent
events.description: A revised draft of the Maxwell indictment, incorporating additional details and comments, is sent to the prosecution team.

keyFacts: The document is internal prosecution correspondence regarding the drafting of the indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell.
The emails show active collaboration and revision of the indictment draft in June 2020, shortly before Maxwell's arrest.
A key legal point under discussion is the question of 'over acts', a term often related to proving conspiracy charges.
All identifiable names (sender/recipient) in the email headers are redacted, indicated by placeholders like '(USANYS)'.
The document demonstrates the pre-arrest preparation phase of the Maxwell prosecution by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.
